Description: Fragment of lip, neck and oval handle to sharp turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine buff. Rectangular stamp.
Curator's comments: Name Ariston. An example from the Athenian Agora, SS13129, is from the same die, as is Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, MGR P.16044
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (81)
